item.title: Cv
item.description: Education PhD Student, Population Biology Graduate Group, University of California Davis, Davis, CA, Fall 2016 – Present, Advisor: Jeff Ross-Ibarra B.A., Biology, University of Chicago, Chicago, IL, 2014 Publications Hudson, A. I., Fleming-Davies, A. E., Páez, D. J. and Dwyer, G. (2016), Genotype-by-genotype interactions between an insect and its pathogen. J. Evol. Biol., 29: 2480–2490. (http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/jeb.12977/). Presentations 2018 Poster: Deleterious variants and genotype by environment interactions in Zea mays. Population, Evolutionary, and Quantitative Genetics, Madison, WI.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a PhD student in the Population Biology Graduate Group at UC Davis and a member of the Ross-Ibarra Lab. I study genotype by environment (GxE) interactions in plants. Genetic variation can cause individuals of the same species to respond in different ways to environmental conditions. These interaction effects are important both for the evolution and ecology of wild species as well as the breeding of crop species. I am interested in questions such as: What is the genetic basis of GxE interactions?
